amendment.description: Amendment sought to prohibit the use of funds made available to the Forest Service for the construction of roads, nor the preparation of timber sales, in roadless areas comprising 3,000 or more acres in size.
amendment.purpose: An amendment printed in the Congressional Record of July 12, as amendment No. 56, that prohibits the use of funds made available to the Forest Service for construction of roads, or preparation of timber sales, in roadless areas comprising 3,000 acres or more.

action.text: Mr. Hansen raised a point of order against the Kennedy (MA) amendment (A040). Mr. Hansen stated that the amendment would have the effect of legislating on an appropriations bill, and therefore violates House rules. Point of order overruled by the Chair.

vote.text: On agreeing to the Kennedy (MA) amendment (A040) Failed by recorded vote: 166 - 255 (Roll no. 522).
